newsitem.title: POLAND: Greek president calms Polish unease over EU, NATO.
newsitem.headline: Greek president calms Polish unease over EU, NATO.

text.p: Greek president Costis Stephanopoulos on Tuesday drove home the message that his country would welcome Poland into the European Union and NATO, soothing some apprehensions in Warsaw.
"We are convinced that the EU will never be a uniform whole unless all European countries who wish to participate in the EU's work become members," he said, singling out Poland.
Stephanopoulos told a joint sitting of parliament's foreign affairs committees in Warsaw that Poland's entry might affect the economic interests of some members, including Greece.
"But we lay stress on political aspects of the broadening of the European Union," he said.
Warsaw has been anxious that less wealthy EU members, such as Greece, might raise obstacles to its entry because Poland could become a rival for limited EU funds.
